Dear Mrs Lazear:
div1.p:
I have just been writing
to Mr Thomas C. Lazear telling him about
the progress of our pension bill. In the
Senate the Committee on Pensions took
both the bills, 1157 and 1168, and made one
bill out of it, S. 6350, recommended its
passage and on March 30th the Senate
passed the bill -- giving both you and
Mrs Carroll $125 a month pension in
lieu of your regular pension of 21 and
37 dollars respectively. Now the bill is in
the House and referred, as is usual, to
the Pension Com. of the House, where the
other two bills are also i.e. those introduced
by Congr. Henshaw. H.R. 4375 and 4377.
If we can get the Pension Com. to do as
the one in the Senate did, they will sub-
stitute the S. 6350 for the two House bills
and recommend their postponement and
the passage of the Senate bill -- and, I am
quite certain that the House will pass the
bill, if so recommended, and I am sure
that the President will sign it.

The House bills are in the hands of a special Committee of
the whole Pension Committee, Messrs. Loudenslager,
(Chairman of the whole Committee) Wm Richardson of Alaba-
ma, who has come out whole souled for the bills, and
Wm H. Draper of Troy, New York, of whom I cannot, so
far, find out where he stands, and Loudenslager thinks
that if he recommends the passage of the bills, he will
break some rules of the Committee on Pensions.

Mr Mead will try and have the Commercial organizations
of Mr Loudenslagers district interview him; possibly they
can persuade him not to be quite so particular about
rules (of course not for your sake but for his own). Some-
how these Congressmen are more anxious to please these
powerful commercial bodies, than poor doctors; how
ever the doctors of his distinct are not asleep, I
will not let them sleep whilst I need their help, for
whatever little that may count. Finally we have one
trump card, we do not mean to play until we have
to, call up the bill for passage over the head of the
Committee, if worst comes to worst. In the main I
think we are doing quite well, Thank You!

I received your telegram and answered it. Did
you receive the answer?
div1.closer: As ever sincerely yours ASV Mansfelde.
